alert.note: Alert for Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 1:08PM PDT until August 09 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following county, Mineral. * WHEN...Until 230 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Along the western shore of Walker Lake. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - US-95 along the western shore of Walker Lake is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... US-95 between Bald Mountain and Schurz. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
